ticket.title: improved reporting of failed expression in assert_difference
ticket.original-body:
Patch improves message output when an expression specified in #assert_difference fails. This is useful for when there are multiple expressions provided as an array to help identify which one was actually in error.
Currently assert_difference just outputs that the expected and actual value was, but not what actually failed.
@@@ ruby assert_difference ['Post.count', 'current_user.posts.count'] do save_a_new_post end @@@
If one of the expressions fails in the above code, there is no way to tell from the assertion failure message which one: `<1> expected but was <0>.`
With the patch, the message will be: `<current_user.posts.count> was expression that failed. <1> expected but was <0>.`
ticket.latest-body:
Patch improves message output when an expression specified in #assert_difference fails. This is useful for when there are multiple expressions provided as an array to help identify which one was actually in error.
Currently assert_difference just outputs that the expected and actual value was, but not what actually failed.
@@@ ruby assert_difference ['Post.count', 'current_user.posts.count'] do save_a_new_post end @@@
If one of the expressions fails in the above code, there is no way to tell from the assertion failure message which one: `<1> expected but was <0>.`
With the patch, the message will be: `<current_user.posts.count> was expression that failed. <1> expected but was <0>.`
ticket.original-body-html:
Patch improves message output when an expression specified in #assert_difference fails. This is useful for when there are multiple expressions provided as an array to help identify which one was actually in error.

Currently assert_difference just outputs that the expected and actual value was, but not what actually failed.


assert_difference ['Post.count', 'current_user.posts.count'] do
  save_a_new_post
end

If one of the expressions fails in the above code, there is no way to tell from the assertion failure message which one: <1> expected but was <0>.

With the patch, the message will be: was expression that failed. <1> expected but was <0>.

version.body:
Patch improves message output when an expression specified in #assert_difference fails. This is useful for when there are multiple expressions provided as an array to help identify which one was actually in error.
Currently assert_difference just outputs that the expected and actual value was, but not what actually failed.
@@@ ruby assert_difference ['Post.count', 'current_user.posts.count'] do save_a_new_post end @@@
If one of the expressions fails in the above code, there is no way to tell from the assertion failure message which one: `<1> expected but was <0>.`
With the patch, the message will be: `<current_user.posts.count> was expression that failed. <1> expected but was <0>.`
version.body-html:
Patch improves message output when an expression specified in #assert_difference fails. This is useful for when there are multiple expressions provided as an array to help identify which one was actually in error.

Currently assert_difference just outputs that the expected and actual value was, but not what actually failed.


assert_difference ['Post.count', 'current_user.posts.count'] do
  save_a_new_post
end

If one of the expressions fails in the above code, there is no way to tell from the assertion failure message which one: <1> expected but was <0>.

With the patch, the message will be: <current_user.posts.count> was expression that failed. <1> expected but was <0>.
version.title: improved reporting of failed expression in assert_difference

version.body:
(from [00e2ba76b21d3c433a0ecda0de28d931c34d1791]) added nicer failure reporting to #assert_difference to tell you the expression that failed rather than just the expected and actual values
Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski <michael@koziarski.com> [#1161 state:committed] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/00e2ba76b21d3c433a0ecda0de28d931c34d1791
version.body-html:
(from [00e2ba76b21d3c433a0ecda0de28d931c34d1791]) added nicer failure reporting to #assert_difference to tell you the expression that failed rather than just the expected and actual values

Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski michael@koziarski.com [#1161 state:committed] http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
version.title: improved reporting of failed expression in assert_difference

version.body: Noticed that the final commit had an extra "the" added to the generated message, but the included unit test for the change wasn't updated, and is now causing unit test failures.
version.body-html: Noticed that the final commit had an extra "the" added to the generated message, but the included unit test for the change wasn't updated, and is now causing unit test failures.
